name: St. Stephen the Younger

locations.description: Monk martyred for defending icons during the Iconoclast Controversy

summary: Stephen the Younger was a Byzantine monk who was martyred for his defense of icons during the Iconoclast Controversy. He was a leading opponent of the iconoclastic policies of Emperor Constantine V. He was arrested, tortured, and executed for refusing to renounce the veneration of icons. He is venerated as a martyr and saint in both the Eastern Orthodox and Catholic Churches.
